verses.roman:
iti dvāpara urv-īśa
stuvanti jagad-īśvaram
nānā-tantra-vidhānena
kalāv api yathā śṛṇu

synonyms: iti—thus; dvāpare—in the Dvāpara Age; uru-īśa—O King; stuvanti—they praise; jagat-īśvaram—the Lord of the universe; nānā—various; tantra—of scriptures; vidhānena—by the regulations; kalau—in the Age of Kali; api—also; yathā—in which manner; śṛṇu—please hear.
translation: "O King, in this way people in Dvāpara-yuga worshiped the Lord of the universe. In Kali-yuga they also worship the Supreme Personality of Godhead by the regulations of the revealed scriptures. Kindly now hear of that from me.

purport.content: This verse is spoken by Saint Karabhājana in Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam (11.5.31).
